intro: Aylostera narvaecense, commonly known as the Narrowleaf Aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical or subtropical woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
